channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lime bikes blocking road, footpath and car parking, 7th December
item.description:
There are about 30 - 40 bikes blocking the footpath, road and resident parking spaces on Canonbury Lane. They are overflowing form a designate hire bike parking spaces.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tyndale Terrace, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement in very poor state of repair, 7th December
item.description:
The pavement of the Balham high road in central Balham is in a very poor state. There’s a huge number of broken and loose paving slabs - that move and represent a real trip hazard. It’s bad from the junction with old Devonshire Road all the way down to Balham Station Road My elderly mother recently tripped on one of the lose slabs near to the Trinity Hospice shop. Thankfulky she regained her balance as otherwise could have seriously hurt herself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Balham High Road, Balham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fluorescent light in front of house entrance., 7th December
item.description:
This fluorescent light has been left on the street almost one week ago. Hackney Council didn't collect this on the normal waste collection day. It does not belong to us or any of our neighbours. Can this please be collected?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunlace Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste bin not being emptied, 7th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ellingfort Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Flytipping issue reported as fixed but it has not been cleared, 7th December
item.description:
Ped frames have been flytipped here since at least late September. The issue has been reported on this site twice but not resolved. Since it was originally reported, more items have been flytipped, creating a growing eyesore and waste issue. Please clear these items as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmington Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
